p: We obtained a set of climatic variables from the WorldClim database ( http://www.worldclim.org) at a 30” resolution to define the species distribution models for current climate (average for 1960–1990) and future climatic (average for 2041–2060) scenarios. The projection was based on the general circulation models of HadGEM 2‐AO of the Fifth Assessment Report of the International Panel of Climate Change. The simulation used HadGEM 2‐AO which performed well in the East Asia region (Baek et al., 2013). The scenario was described in terms of the Representative Concentration Pathways 4.5, which predict an average global temperature increase of 0.9–2.0°C by the 2050s (UNFCCC, 2015). The time horizon of the 2050s was selected because it is a period far enough in the future for significant climate changes to have occurred (Young et al., 2012).
